bibl.title: Charles Barnes v. J.H. McGraw. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington, County of King. } ss
G.W. Caufield Justice of the Peace in and for Osceola Precinct
To the Sheriff of King County and the keeper of the jail of King County

WHEREAS, at a Justice's Court held at my office, in said county, for the trial of Charles Barnes for the offense hereinafter stated, the said Charles Barnes was convicted of having, on the Third day of January in 1886, in said County, committed the offense of drawing a revolver on Charles Forger in his house in the County of King and entering said house with John Barnes and staying with him when he shot Eugene Cote and wounded him and drawing the revolver at the same time and place and upon conviction, the said Court did adjudge and determine that said Charles Barnes should pay the fine of seventy five ($75.00) dollars, and twenty nine 55/100 $29 55/100 dollars costs, and stand committed until the same be paid: and, whereas, the said Charles Barnes has made default in the payment of the same. Therefore, you the said Sheriff or Deputy are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said Charles Barnes to the said keeper; and you, the said keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said Charles Barnes into your custody in said jail, and him there keep at hard labor for the space of 35 thirty five days, unless aid fine and costs be sooner paid, or he shall thence be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this fourth day of January 1886
G.W. Caufield (seal) Justice of the Peace in and for Osceola Precinct King County, Washington Territory
